Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style or Grand Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two added white bands; exterior: two wide black bands; painted inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '35' is written in pencil on the interior surface. Given the size of the sherd, the exterior and interior decoration are consistent with the Mature Animal Style and Grand styles. Painted inscriptions (dipinti) are usually found on kantharoi.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 198)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 731, no. 918)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0664) (phase 2)
